alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Allen; Avoyelles; East Cameron; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Lafayette; St. Landry; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lafayette, eastern Jefferson Davis, Evangeline, Acadia, northwestern Vermilion, south central Avoyelles, St. Landry and southeastern Allen Parishes through 300 AM CDT... At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Beaver to near Iota to Thornwell. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Opelousas, Crowley, Eunice, Jennings, Scott, Rayne, Oakdale, Carencro, Ville Platte, Kaplan, Church Point, Mamou, Lake Arthur, Basile, Iota, Gueydan, Elton, Leonville and Mermentau. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 58 and 100. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Allen; Avoyelles; East Cameron; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Lafayette; St. Landry; Vermilion
